JAUSTRALIA PRESS STATEMENT NO. 531
16 July 1975
I. W. Y. CONFERENCE WOMEN POLITICS
Australia's lready significant contribution to International
Women's Year would achieve new goals with a major conference on
women and politics to be held in Canberra soon, the Prime
Minister, the Hon. E. G. Whitlam, announced today.
Mr Whitlam said the Women and Politics Conference would be held
0 at the Australian National University, Canberra, from August
to September 6.
It would bring together women from all over Australia and
selected speakers from overseas to create a greater understanding
of the means ty which women could participate in the making of
political decisions. The Conference also would highlight the
difficulties confronting women who desired to be politically
active.
S Mr Whitlam said that already Australia's efforts in International
O Women's Year were receiving world-wide attention. This new
Conference, to which both women and men were being invited, would
be an historic event for Australia's women and for Australia's
politics.
0 He said that cth traditional and new viewpoints were being sought
and the Conference would be a focal point of exchange of ideas
between those -ho had previously been politically active and
those who would like to be.
It would be an opportunity for women from other nations to share
their experiences in achieving significant social and political
change wit ' in their own communities. About 20 outstanding
women from cverseas will participate.
And ultimately, it would be the base from which women themselves
can launch a renewed attack on community attitudes now preventing
them from playing their full role in creating a more humane, a
more compassionate society. / 2
